title: Hoisin-Sesame Dipping Sauce
source: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
categories: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
directions: 1. Heat vegetable oil in a small saucepan over medium heat until shimmering.
2. Add ginger and garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
3. Stir in hoisin, water, vinegar, soy sauce, and sesame oil and cook until flavors meld, about 3 minutes.
5. Serve warm or at room temperature. (Sauce can be refrigerated for up to 4 days; let come to room temperature before serving.)
